DESCRIPTION OF THE PREFERRED EMBODIMENTSThe protein-bound polysaccharide used as an active ingredient in the binding agent of the present invention is disclosed in, for example, Japanese Examined Patent Publications (Kokai) No. 46-17149, No. 51-36322, No. 56-14274, No. 56-14275, and No. 56-14276. The protein-bound polysaccharide is an extract from mycelia, broth, or fruit bodies that is obtained by culturing the fungus belonging to Coriolus, which belongs to Basidiomycetes. The protein-bound polysaccharide contains about 18 to 38% by weight of proteins, and has a molecular weight of not less than 5,000, preferably 5000 to 3000,000. Further, the protein-bound polysaccharide is described in "Saikin no Shinyaku (Recent New Medicines)", Vol. 28, 14-16, 1977; and Vol. 29, 96-101, 1978; and "Iyakuhin Yoran (Handbook of Medicines)", 6th Ed., 1346, 1979, published by Yakuji Jiho Publishing Co.
